title: Data Collection and Graphs

vocab.definition: Information that we collect and organize
A picture that shows information in an organized way
A graph that uses bars of different lengths to show data
A way to count by making marks
Asking people questions to collect information

teachingNotes: Start with simple surveys about student preferences. Show how to organize data using tally marks and create basic bar graphs. Practice reading and interpreting simple graphs together.

sample.question: What does a bar graph show us?
What tool shows counts as groups of five?
What do we call asking people questions to collect information?

If a bar is taller, does it mean more or less?
What shows information in picture form?

truefalse.question: Tally marks help us count things.

Surveys are used to collect data from people.

Tally marks are made in groups of 4.
